conversation.content: Good afternoon. I need clarification on international transaction fees that appeared on my account statement from last week's European trip.
Good afternoon, and thank you for calling. I'd be happy to explain those fees in detail. May I have your account number to review the specific transactions?
Certainly. The account number is 4521-7893-2156.

Thank you. I can see your account here with three international transactions from Frankfurt on October 12th totaling $847.50, and two from Paris on October 14th for $623.00. Each transaction incurred our standard 3% foreign transaction fee.
I wasn't aware of the three percent fee. Is this applied to all international purchases?
Yes, the 3% fee applies to all transactions processed outside the United States. For your Frankfurt purchases, that resulted in fees of $25.43, and your Paris transactions generated $18.69 in fees.
That's significant. Are there any cards you offer without these fees?

Absolutely. We have two excellent options: our Platinum Global card with product code PGC-500 has no foreign transaction fees and earns 2X points on international purchases, and our Executive Travel card, ETC-750, which also waives these fees.
What are the annual fees for those cards?

Certainly. The Platinum Global card has an annual fee of $195, while the Executive Travel card is $450 annually but includes additional benefits like airport lounge access and travel insurance coverage up to $100,000.
I travel internationally about four times per year. Would switching cards make financial sense?

Based on your transaction history showing $8,400 in international purchases over the past twelve months, you'd save approximately $252 in foreign transaction fees annually, which would more than offset the Platinum Global's annual fee.
That's helpful. Can you waive the fees on my recent transactions?

I understand your concern. While I cannot retroactively remove standard fees, I can offer you a one-time courtesy credit of $22.00, which covers approximately half of your recent charges, reference number CR-89234-TK.
I appreciate that. How quickly could I switch to the Platinum Global card?

I can process that application immediately. With your excellent payment history and credit score of 785, you'd receive instant approval and the card would arrive via express delivery within 2-3 business days.
Perfect. Will my current rewards points transfer to the new card?
Yes, all 47,829 points in your current rewards balance will automatically transfer to your new Platinum Global account, and you'll receive a 10,000-point welcome bonus after your first purchase.
Excellent. Please proceed with the Platinum Global application and the courtesy credit.

I've submitted your application, which is approved with a credit limit of $25,000. Your new card ending in 8834 will arrive by October 21st, and the $22.00 credit will appear within 24 hours. Is there anything else I can assist you with today?

scenario: trying to understand international transaction fees
